monogr.title: A way of reconciliation of a good and learned man : touching the trueth, nature, and substance of the body and blood of Christ in the sacrament. Translated out of Latin into English by the right honorable Lady Elizabeth Russell, dowager to the right honourable the Lord Iohn Russell, Baron, and sonne and heire to Francis Earle of Bedford

div.head: The Author to the Reader.
div.p: TO seeke the attonement of men is to be commended, and it hath a sure promise of God: Blessed bee the peace-makers. But I feare me, lest in greedily following the same, it happen to me which chanceth to them that part fraies, while they seeke others safetie, they beare the blowes themselues. And I, while I study to make enemies friends, perhaps shall haue small thankes of them. Which if it happen, the example of him shal comfort me, which said: If I should please men, I should not be the seruant of Christ. Farewell, and indeauour thy selfe to please Christ.
